p:
In the absence of interventions such as HAART or vaccines, the population converges to equilibrium levels of population size, HIV prevalence, and perceived infection risk ( b) ( Figs 1 and 2). HIV prevalence is highest in 20–29 and 30–39 year olds. The average perceived infection risk b
t is similar to the HIV prevalence, although HIV− individuals tend to underestimate HIV infection risk and HIV+ individuals tend to slightly overestimate it. The perceived infection risk tends to be lowest in 15–19 year olds.
